_id.title: Object ID container
_id.description: An object that contains a unique object ID

$oid.title: Object ID
$oid.description: The unique object ID for this entry

url.title: Original URL
url.description: The original URL from which the domain name was extracted

$date.description: The date and time of when the entry was first processed by the collector (ISO8601-formatted, in UTC)

source.title: Entry Source Identifier
source.description: The identifier of the source that provided the domain name

$date.description: The date and time of when the entry was loaded from the source (ISO8601-formatted, in UTC)

A.description: Array of IPv4 addresses associated with the domain name. Null if no records were found.

AAAA.description: Array of IPv6 addresses associated with the domain name. Null if no records were found.

CNAME.description: The single canonical name associated with the domain name. Null if a CNAME record was not found.

value.description: The canonical name associated with the domain name

related_ips.description: Array of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses resolved for the canonical name through a public resolver (non-authoritative data)

MX.description: Array of objects that describe the associated MX records. Null if no records were found.

anyOf.description: When MX records are available, the MX object will contain several properties whose keys are the MX names and the values are objects that describe the individual records

related_ips.description: Array of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses resolved for the MX name through a public resolver (non-authoritative data)

NS.description: Array of objects that describe the associated NS records. Null if no records were found.

anyOf.description: When NS records are available, the NS object will contain several properties whose keys are the NS names and the values are objects that describe the individual records

related_ips.description: Array of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses resolved for the NS name through a public resolver (non-authoritative data)

TXT.description: Array of string values from the TXT records. Null if no records were found.

SOA.description: The SOA record that corresponds to the input domain name. If the name is a subdomain, this should be null.

zone_SOA.description: The SOA record of the zone determined for the input domain name. If the name is a not subdomain, this should be null and the SOA field should be populated instead. Sometimes, the nameserver returned a different SOA for the two performed queries, and in that case, both zone_SOA and SOA are populated.

dnssec.description: The scanner checks whether DNSSEC signatures exist and are valid 'locally', according to the DNSKEY found in the zone. These enum values indicate the DNSSEC status for each RRtype.

remarks.description: Additional metadata about the DNS scan

has_dnskey.description: Flag indicating that a DNSKEY record was found

zone_dnskey_selfsign_ok.description: Flag indicating that the RRsig of the DNSKEY record corresponds to the DNSKEY record

zone.description: The domain name of the zone determined for the input domain name

has_spf.description: Flag indicating that an SPF TXT record was found

has_dmarc.description: Flag indicating that a DMARC TXT record was found

has_dkim.description: Flag indicating that a DKIM TXT record was found

sources.description: The scanner first tries to resolve from the primary NS. In case of failures, it falls back to a public recursive resolver. These enum values indicate the source of the data for each RRtype.

ttls.description: The TTL values for all resolved RRsets. 0 if the RRtype was not found.

rdap.title: RDAP or WHOIS Data
rdap.description: Data fetched from RDAP or WHOIS services. Refer to the RDAP RFCs for more information on their semantics.

entities.title: RDAP Entities
entities.description: Array of objects that describe the entities fetched from RDAP. If WHOIS was used, only 'registrar', 'abuse', 'registrant', and 'admin' will be present. The properties defined below are examples that occur frequently but are not exhaustive.

$date.description: The date and time of when the DNS scan was performed (ISO8601-formatted, in UTC)
The date and time of when the RDAP/WHOIS data were fetched (ISO8601-formatted, in UTC)
The date and time of when the TLS data were fetched (ISO8601-formatted, in UTC)

dns_had_no_ips.title: No IPs Found Flag
dns_had_no_ips.description: Flag indicating that no IP addresses were found in the DNS records

ip_data.title: IP Data
ip_data.description: Array of data objects capturing the IP addresses related to the domain name

label.description: An unused field whose value should not be relied upon

category.description: An unused field whose value should not be relied upon

dnssecType.description: 0 = no RRsig found, 1 = RRsig corresponds to the local DNSKEY, 2 = RRsig does not correspond to the key, 3 = no DNSKEY found in the domain

resolvedRecordSourceType.description: 0 = resolved from the primary nameserver, 1 = resolved through a public recursive resolver, 2 = not found

rdapEntity.title: RDAP Entity
rdapEntity.description: An entity fetched from RDAP. If WHOIS was used, only 'name' or 'email' will be present. Refer to the RDAP RFCs for more information on the possible fields and their meanings.
